Posts.Content: Deb-from-Ohio wrote: I hope no one laughs at this, posted it another forum also, this is driving me crazy.....but my  heels are killing me!!!!!!! I can't hardly walk on them, I've done nothing else, the only thing I can think of is to believe the chemo somehow caused this....While i do have rough skin there, calloused and all, it hurts to even touch them......I've been putting lotion on by the tons, no help.......... Can A/C cause something like this? Or is it all in my head? Luv, hugs and prayers Deb Dx 10/23/2008, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 2, 1/5 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Strange SE Deb-from-Ohio Deb-from-Ohio

Posts.Content: Deb-from-Ohio wrote: I had the most horrible day of my life today...I had a MUGA and MRI scheduled, get to the hospital they've messed up and had my mri scheduled wrong, got that straightened out, go into the muga..he gives me a shot to ready my blood for the radioactive stuff, then gives me the radioactive stuff...lays me down on this table with my hands over my head which hurt like you know because I just got that port in yesterday, leaves me laying there for 5 mins, comes back and says that the syringe screwed up, he has to give me the radioactive stuff again as it's in my hand and not the veins.....so spent 30 mins laying there in pain, next go to the mri.....first off, they want me to lay on this table on my stomach which would have been fine except where my port was would have hit right on the edge of the padding on the table, this stupid lady gives me two pieces of guaze and tells me that will pad it....then she tries to put in the iv, I told her my veins roll and to use my hands, she says no, we do that as a last resort, so she sticks it in my arm..it rolled.....she's moving the needle all over.....she finally pulls it out, tries again in a different spot, for like 4 minutes she's doing it again moving it all over the place, it hurt so bad I was crying...she's telling me to breathe! I finally ended up telling her to take it out and I would reschedule....I cried all the way home, cried for an hour at home and off and on all evening.....that's with a xanax and vicodeine.........Do they have to attempt to kill you to make you better?  Thoughts and prayers Deb Dx 10/23/2008, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 2, 1/5 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I broke down today Deb-from-Ohio Harley44

Posts.Content: Deb-from-Ohio wrote: I'm on the 12 weekly sessions of Taxol...did anyone else get the blues from this?  I just sit here in my own little world, all depressed for a few days till it wears off..but it sure is aggravating.....Is this one of the side effects of Taxol or is it just me and I really am getting depressed. Today all I want to do is cry. Hugs Deb Dx 10/23/2008, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 2, 1/5 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Taxol and the Blues? Deb-from-Ohio Deb-from-Ohio

Posts.Content: Deb-from-Ohio wrote: I was told by my breast surgeon that she could not do a masectomy on me as I smoke. She said something about a smokers blood cells pulse and if she did this, it would leave a black line all around where she had to cut.....several people have told me now this is bull.......I did have a hysterectomy back in 93 and that healed perfectly...Are there any women on here who have had a masectomy and smoke? If so, how did you heal? Luv, hugs and prayers Deb Dx 10/23/2008, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 2, 1/5 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Deb-from-Ohio wrote: i finished chemo like almost 3 weeks ago, had 4 every other week A/C's and 12 weekly Taxol...my left foot and leg swells up big time now....anyone heard of this or do you think it could be from something else? Thanks! Deb Dx 10/23/2008, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 2, 1/5 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
